name: Company of Heroes: Tales of Valor
description: Company of Heroes®: Tales of Valor™ is the expansion to the Game of the Year winner and highest rated real time strategy franchise Company of Heroes®. Featuring new campaigns to overcome, units to command, and battlefields to conquer, Company of Heroes®: Tales of Valor™ delivers evolved gameplay mechanics and 3 episodic adventures...
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows® XP or Vista                     Processor: SSE capable processor, 2.0 Ghz Intel Pentium IV or equivalent or AMD Athlon XP or equivalent.                      Memory: 512 MB RAM. 1GB MB RAM required for Vista                      Graphics: DirectX 9.0c compatible 64MB video card with Pixel Shader 1.1 support or equivalent and latest manufacturer drivers                     Sound: DirectX® 9.0c compatible 16-bit sound card

I've been playing this game for years (long before the weird steam version hours started counting), and I always come back to this game for clean RTS fun. There are few games that hit just about everything you want in an RTS like Company of Heroes, including longevity. This game is far better than CoH2, offering great balance, (still) great graphics and performance, entire standalone games as DLC (instead of crummy map packs), and a modding community with years of material for you to explore (including the amazing Eastern Front mod which does everything and more that CoH2 does). I don't think I'll ever stop playing this game.

Company of Heroes - Talors of Valor, was at first not a game I would of originally bought but after playing the game with friends on the mod 'Blitzkreig' it became interesting to play.  I wouldn't say Company of heroes is about base building but more about having units take strategic places on the map and holding them by taking resource points. When you get a kill you get given experience which you can put points into like a talent tree system; this only makes your units better or unlocks special off map support options.   The Blitzkreig mod which works for this version of company of heroes gives more options in the command trees and more units unlocked making each team seem more balanced compared to the original talors of valor game.

Note: Only played CoH's Campaign and my hours are chalked up against the new steam edition of CoH.  Tales of Valor's campaigns breath fresh life into CoH by introducing some interesting mission/campaign features. While these features are unique to Tales of Valor, at the same time they feel at home within the CoH universe. Some of these mission features include a rotating map, alerting your units to an incoming attack and commanding an overpowered lone wolf tank against the British!
